intro: Psychotria palimlimensis, commonly known as the Malayan Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in tropical rainforests, thriving in humid and shaded environments. Psychotria palimlimensis is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
